ygData.subject: Tip: DNSJava on non-English Windows
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, I am using Heritrix on a non-English Windows (i.e. German) and I constantly got a NullPointerException that could be traced to the line

Subject: Tip: DNSJava on non-English Windows
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=81478527; y=eCthvImKhjoKcu5ihu-xIZiWtWce9HseUZ1SoWN9Ug6WlTteAV4-W17M
X-Yahoo-Profile: holgerstenzhorn

Hi,

I am using Heritrix on a non-English Windows (i.e. German) and I
constantly got a NullPointerException that could be traced to the line
"curi.putString(A_DNS_SERVER_IP_LABEL, FindServer.server());" in the
class "FetchDNS" because the method "FindServer.server()" returned
null always.

A little bit of debugging showed that DNSJava relies on parsing the
output of the native command "ipconfig /all" which is localized.
DNSJava uses property files for the terms used in that output and the
source distribution actually contains property files for German and
Polish too BUT these files are not included in the distribution JAR.

If you download the sources of 1.6.6 there is a little caveat: The
"ResolverConfig" class asks for the key "primary_dns_suffix_key" but
in the property this is called "primary_dns_suffix".
I told that the guys over at DNSJava and it is gonna be fixed in
version 2.0.1

Holger
